org.apache.xpath

Class ArithmeticOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.xpath.Expression
      • org.apache.xpath.operations.Operation
        • org.apache.xpath.ArithmeticOperation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.xml.transform.SourceLocator, ExpressionNode, ExpressionOwner, XPathVisitable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Div, IDiv, Minus, Mod, Mult, Plus

    public class ArithmeticOperation
extends Operation
    A class providing utility methods for arithmetic operations +, -, div & mod, to support Xalan-J's XSLT 3.0 implementation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • arithmeticOpOnXNumberValues

        protected XObject arithmeticOpOnXNumberValues(XNumber lNumber,
                                              XNumber rNumber,
                                              java.lang.String opSymbol)
                                       throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method does an arithmetic operation on two XNumber object values. A numeric literal from a text data source, is always constructed to an XNumber object value by Xalan-J's XPath parser.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

      • getXNumberFromXSNumericType

        protected XNumber getXNumberFromXSNumericType(XSNumericType xsNumericType)
        Get XNumber object value from an XSNumericType object value.

      • divOpArithmeticExceptionAction

        protected XObject divOpArithmeticExceptionAction(java.math.BigDecimal lBigDecimal,
                                                 java.math.BigDecimal rBigDecimal,
                                                 java.lang.String exceptionMesg)
                                          throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method specifies the processing that takes place, when ArithmeticException occurs on 'div' operator's evaluation.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

      • error

        protected void error(java.lang.String errMesg,
                     java.lang.String[] args)

      • doubleDiv

        protected XObject doubleDiv(double lDouble,
                            double rDouble)
        Given two double operands for arithmetic division, do the division and return the result as an XDM numeric value.
        Parameters:
        lDouble - division left operand
        rDouble - division left operand
        Returns:
        An XSDouble or XSDecimal result value
